text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
IDMPProductModel 0..*ElementIDMPIdentifiableProductModel
name 0..*BackboneElementProduct Name
nameType 1..1CodingName type
name 0..1stringName
classification 0..*CodeableConceptClassification
identifier 0..*BackboneElementIdentifiers
pcid 0..1IdentifierIDMP PCID
mpid 0..1IdentifierIDMP MPID
phpid4 0..1IdentifierIDMP PhPID Level 4
Example (illustrative): 0x073AF2E5B92AE19E8B67635AFFB3D6CA
marketingAuthorizationHolder 0..1CodeableConceptAuthorized Dose Form
doseForm 1..1CodeableConceptAuthorized Dose Form
Example (edqm): 10210000 capsule, hard
unitOfPresentation 1..1CodeableConceptUnit of presentation
Example (edqm): 15012000 capsule
routeOfAdministration 1..1CodeableConceptRoute of administration
ingredient 1..*BackboneElementIngredient(s) that are part of the product, with therapeutical usage or not
substance 1..1CodeableConceptCodification of the substance
Example (illustrative): Amlodipine Besilate
strength 1..1BackboneElementAuthorized strength of the substance
strengthValue 1..1BackboneElementStrength of the substance in this product
numerator 1..1SimpleQuantityStrength numerator
Example (illustrative): 5 mg
denominator 1..1SimpleQuantityStrength denominator
referenceStrength 1..1BackboneElementAuthorized strength of the substance
referenceStrengthSubstance 1..1CodeableConceptThe substance used to determine the strength
referenceStrengthValue 1..1BackboneElementStrength of the substance in this product
numerator 1..1SimpleQuantityStrength numerator
Example (illustrative): 5 mg
denominator 1..1SimpleQuantityStrength denominator
packaging 0..*BackboneElementPackaging
packageSize 0..1QuantityPackage Size

Documentation for this format

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both
